intro: Rondeletia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Rondeletia hirsuta is often cultivated for its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
